scenario_title: Recurrent Fraud by Masquerader via Modification of Key Data Files

why.details: The masquerader sought to obtain financial gain or personal advantage by repeatedly modifying sensitive or valuable data files, aiming to misguide the employees and gain higher privilege of the attacker.

how.description: Accessed key data files either by using compromised credentials, leveraging existing privileges, or requesting additional access under false pretenses.
how.procedure: Masquerader uses valid or stolen credentials, or leverages trust relationships, to gain access to data files not normally within the userâ€™s scope.
observable_evidence: Access attempts to sensitive directories by account not typically permitted
Use of credentials outside typical role scope or time-window
Emails or requests for access under false pretext
how.impact: Initial foothold into key data assets enables subsequent fraudulent manipulation.

how.description: Modified financial reports and customer records to misrepresent company data and gain unauthorized benefits.
how.procedure: Adversary inserts, deletes or changes stored data (e.g., financial records, customer information) in order to mislead business processes or cover fraud activity. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}
observable_evidence: Database records or files altered without corresponding change-logs or authorization
Unexpected changes in financial report totals inconsistent with business logic
Customer data if modified leading to unexplained account changes
how.impact: Corrupted data integrity leads to financial loss, regulatory non-compliance, reputational damage.

how.description: Altered system audit logs or permission settings to cover traces of unauthorized modifications and escalate access privileges.
how.procedure: Adversary tampers with log files or permissions settings to remove evidence of the fraudulent manipulation, thereby hiding activity and facilitating repeated mis-use of privileges.
observable_evidence: Deletion or modification of system/audit logs without standard process
Changes in file permissions or user roles not logged through change management
Unusual user account privilege changes outside formal workflow
how.impact: Reduced detectability of fraudulent manipulation; repeated misuse of data assets increases cumulative loss.
